relation: Great for these types of students
They are pretty good at that!
There are a lot to get into but one 1 frat and 1 sorority.
Great for liberal arts students and students that accept culture and sexual preference.
Ehh, it is a bit over priced if you ask me.
Go out and club or go for walks.
The dorms are nice but some students are a bit rowdy.
It is a nice balace of hard and easy as long as you are not in biology.
Make sure you know what majors are good at the school. (Biology is not) Also, have a plan for expenses as well as food because it is not good here.
The school is decent. It is good for students interested in the arts. However, be prepared it is ridiculously expensive!

textAfterTable: Food and Dining few choices with on campus dining. there are many places to eat out nearby, including mcdonalds and subway. Dorm Life little to no problems. Academic Rigor classes can be challenging. use the library and free books to your advantage. Tips for prospective students join a club and enjoy those around you. parking is hard to come by. the library has computers that are open pretty much 24/7. In three sentences webster exudes an open atmosphere filled with people that are easy to get along with. the staff is friendly, and personable, and the education quality is top-knotch.
